intro: Dalechampia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf dalechampia, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on different parts of the plant. Dalechampia lanceolata typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
